summary:
The Security Council,

Adopted resolution 2089 (2013) on 24 January 2013,

Welcoming the Secretary-General's report on UNFICYP, 

Noting the Government of Cyprus's agreement to extend UNFICYP's mandate beyond 31 January 2013,

Noting the Secretary-General's intention to report on his Good Offices, 

Echoing his belief that finding a solution lies primarily with the Cypriots, 

Reaffirming the UN's primary role in assisting the parties to achieve a comprehensive and durable settlement,

Welcoming progress in negotiations and leaders' joint statements,

Recalling the importance of full, flexible, and constructive engagement in negotiations,

Encouraging the sides to resume substantive negotiations on core issues,

Welcoming efforts to stimulate progress and supporting continued Good Offices,

Noting the need for military confidence-building measures and renewed efforts to implement remaining measures,

Reaffirming the importance of Green Line crossings and encouraging the opening of other crossing points,

Convinced of the benefits of a comprehensive and durable Cyprus settlement,

Urging the two sides and their leaders to foster positive public rhetoric and explain the benefits of a settlement,

Considering that undermining the UN's credibility undermines the peace process,

Highlighting the supporting role of the international community,

Taking note of the stable security situation but urging avoidance of actions that could increase tension,

Recalling the 1989 aide-memoire and the need for demining operations,

Highlighting the importance of the Committee on Missing Persons and access to all areas,

Agreeing on the essential role of civil society groups, including women's groups,

Welcoming the Secretary-General's intention to review peacekeeping operations.
